intro: Monticalia flosfragrans, commonly known as the fragrant flower of the mountains, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that emit a sweet, aromatic fragrance, especially in the evening. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its stems are covered in fine, soft hairs. Due to its unique scent and habitat, it is a subject of interest in both botanical research and horticultural cultivation.
